38913.name: A Light in the Darkness
38913.flavorText: Wait, how can you have a light in the dark? If you turn on a light while it’s dark, doesn’t that mean it’s no longer dark?

38916.name: Addled Grizzly
38916.text: After you summon a Beast, give it +1/+1.
38916.flavorText: Druids who spend too long in bear form are more susceptible to the whispers of the Old Gods. Right now they are whispering the lyrics to "La Bamba".

38873.name: Ancient Harbinger
38873.text: At the start of your turn, put a 10-Cost minion from your deck into your hand.
38873.flavorText: "honey, can u run down to the store and pick up some 10 cost minions? thx"

38897.name: Ancient Shieldbearer
38897.text: Battlecry: If your C'Thun has at least 10 Attack, gain 10 Armor.
38897.flavorText: Back in her day, each shield weighed two tons and she had to carry four of them on each arm!

38538.name: Bilefin Tidehunter
38538.flavorText: Bile actually makes for surprisingly sturdy fins.

38960.name: Blackwater Pirate
38960.flavorText: "Look, they fell off the back of a ship, do you want them or not? I have a meeting with Y'Shaarj in like ten minutes."

38861.name: Blade of C'Thun
38861.text: Battlecry: Destroy a minion. Add its Attack and Health to your C'Thun's (wherever it is).
38861.flavorText: C'Thun demands a sacrifice! Preferably a Deathwing.

38391.name: Bladed Cultist
38391.flavorText: He has a poor understanding of the law of diminishing returns.

38918.name: Blood To Ichor
38918.text: Deal 1 damage to a minion. If it survives, summon a 2/2 Slime.
38918.flavorText: For his next trick, he turns the ichor back to blood and stuffs it back in you.

38848.name: Blood Warriors
38848.text: Add a copy of each damaged friendly minion to your hand.
38848.flavorText: They have an uneasy rivalry with the Blood Paladins.

38567.name: Blood of The Ancient One
38567.text: If you control two of these at the end of your turn, merge them into 'The Ancient One'.
38567.flavorText: Add two cups of Blood of the Ancient One to one cup of lemon juice. Add just a dash of sugar and stir. Delicious!

38738.name: Bloodhoof Brave
38738.flavorText: He thought the set was called "Flippers of the Old Cods" and hungrily volunteered to be in it. He is definitely going to get his hearing checked.

38920.name: Bloodsail Cultist
38920.text: Battlecry: If you control another Pirate, give your weapon +1/+1.
38920.flavorText: They're really just in it for the Blood Parrot.

38534.name: Bog Creeper
38534.flavorText: He's tried other things, but bog sidling, bog ambling, and bog trundling just aren't as effective as bog creeping.

38857.name: C'Thun
38857.text: Battlecry: Deal damage equal to this minion's Attack randomly split among all enemies.
38857.flavorText: C'Thun's least favorite Hearthstone card: Eye for an Eye.

38863.name: C'Thun's Chosen
38863.text: Divine Shield Battlecry: Give your C'Thun +3/+3 (wherever it is).
38863.flavorText: He gave her a promise ring and everything.

38418.name: Cabalist's Tome
38418.flavorText: What's in there? I bet it's cookie recipes!

38727.name: Call of the Wild
38727.flavorText: "Hello. Misha, Leokk and Huffer aren't here right now, but if you leave a message we'll get back to you right away." BEEP.

38464.name: Cho'gall
38464.text: Battlecry: Return all cards you discarded this game to your hand. They cost Health instead of Mana.
38464.flavorText: Even after all this time, Gul'dan still makes Cho'gall go get donuts and coffee.

38528.name: Corrupted Healbot
38528.text: Deathrattle: Restore 8 Health to the enemy hero.
38528.flavorText: Not so much "corrupted" as "has terrible aim".

38545.name: Corrupted Seer
38545.text: Battlecry: Deal 2 damage to all non-Murloc minions.
38545.flavorText: For seers, it's very handy to have your crystal ball hanging right in front of your face.

38958.name: Crazed Worshipper
38958.text: Taunt Whenever this minion takes damage, give your C'Thun +1/+1 (wherever it is).
38958.flavorText: Every month they share a pancake breakfast with the Perfectly Rational Worshippers.

38888.name: Cult Apothecary
38888.text: Battlecry: For each enemy minion, restore 2 Health to your hero.

38900.name: Cult Sorcerer
38900.text: Spell Damage +1 After you cast a spell, give your C'Thun +1/+1 (wherever it is).
38900.flavorText: No matter how many times we tell her not to, she keeps feeding C'Thun scraps under the table.

39041.name: Cyclopian Horror
39041.text: Taunt. Battlecry: Gain +1 Health for each enemy minion.
39041.flavorText: What are the qualifications for being a 'Horror?' Just how horrible do you have to be?

38770.name: DOOM!
38770.text: Destroy all minions. Draw a card for each.
38770.flavorText: We ran out of space for "DOOOOOOOOOOOM!!!!!"

38882.name: Dark Arakkoa
38882.flavorText: There's a whole gradient of Arakkoa! This one is on the darker side.

38764.name: Darkshire Alchemist
38764.flavorText: The secret ingredient: liquified funnel cake.

38452.name: Darkshire Councilman
38452.text: After you summon a minion, gain +1 Attack.

38447.name: Darkshire Librarian
38447.text: Battlecry: Discard a random card. Deathrattle: Draw a card.
38447.flavorText: Do NOT be late with your overdue fines.

38436.name: Darkspeaker
38436.text: Battlecry: Swap stats with a friendly minion.
38436.flavorText: People often think that Darkspeaker is the arch nemesis of Lightspeaker, but that title actually belongs to Heavyspeaker.

38943.name: Deathwing, Dragonlord
38943.text: Deathrattle: Put all Dragons from your hand into the battlefield.
38943.flavorText: To his credit, Deathwing really took to heart the feedback he was receiving that he needed to be "more of a team player".

38412.name: Demented Frostcaller
38412.text: After you cast a spell, Freeze a random enemy.
38412.flavorText: He prefers that you refer to him by his nickname: 'Frostwaker.'

38547.name: Disciple of C'Thun
38547.text: Battlecry: Deal 2 damage. Give your C'Thun +2/+2 (wherever it is).
38547.flavorText: C’Thun’s recruiting pitch involves cookies, which is why it’s the most popular Old God.

38749.name: Divine Strength
38749.flavorText: Every year a few paladins get disqualified from the Westfall weight lifting championship for using Divine Strength.

38795.name: Doomcaller
38795.text: Battlecry: Give your C'Thun +2/+2 (wherever it is). If it's dead, shuffle it into your deck.
38795.flavorText: "Hello, is Doom there? No? Can I leave a message?"

39002.name: Duskboar
39002.flavorText: Often excluded from dinner parties. To be fair, he is very boaring.

38792.name: Eater of Secrets
38792.text: Battlecry: Destroy all enemy Secrets. Gain +1/+1 for each.
38792.flavorText: You don't want to be around after it has eaten an explosive trap. You thought Sludge Belcher was bad...

38522.name: Eldritch Horror
38522.flavorText: Often wonders what path his life might have taken if he wasn't named, you know, "Eldritch Horror".

38439.name: Embrace the Shadow
38439.text: This turn, your healing effects deal damage instead.
38439.flavorText: For when your Auchenai Soulpriests call in sick.

38265.name: Eternal Sentinel
38265.flavorText: Just try to avoid eye contact.

38266.name: Evolve
38266.text: Transform your minions into random minions that cost (1) more.
38266.flavorText: So you say you want an evolution. Well, you know. We all want to change the board.

38521.name: Faceless Behemoth
38521.flavorText: Rejected names: Forty-Foot Faceless, Big ol' No-face, Huge Creature Sans Face, Teddy.

38569.name: Faceless Shambler
38569.text: Taunt Battlecry: Copy a friendly minion's Attack and Health.
38569.flavorText: "What is that thing?!" "I'm not sure, but it seems to be sort of Ysera shaped."

38725.name: Faceless Summoner
38725.flavorText: They never get the recognition they deserve.

38318.name: Fandral Staghelm
38318.text: Your Choose One cards and powers have both effects combined.
38318.flavorText: Always manages to mention "Back when I was creating the World Tree…" in EVERY conversation. Sheesh! Enough already.

38334.name: Feral Rage
38334.text: Choose One - Give your hero +4 Attack this turn; or Gain 8 Armor.
38334.flavorText: Let's be honest. One option is a lot ragier than the other.

38584.name: Fiery Bat
38584.text: Deathrattle: Deal 1 damage to a random enemy.

38340.name: Forbidden Ancient
38340.text: Battlecry: Spend all your Mana. Gain +1/+1 for each Mana spent.
38340.flavorText: This Ancient was banned from the local tavern after tucking a 'Dr. Boom' up its sleeve.

38413.name: Forbidden Flame
38413.text: Spend all your Mana. Deal that much damage to a minion.
38413.flavorText: WARNING: This flame is not to be used unless you are a licensed acolyte of the Old Gods.

38666.name: Forbidden Healing
38666.text: Spend all your Mana. Restore twice that much Health.
38666.flavorText: No one's quite sure why it's forbidden. And yes, that should make you nervous.

38454.name: Forbidden Ritual
38454.text: Spend all your Mana. Summon that many 1/1 Tentacles.
38454.flavorText: Actually, C'Thun gives his full support for this ritual.

38434.name: Forbidden Shaping
38434.text: Spend all your Mana. Summon a random minion that costs that much.
38434.flavorText: But the minion arrives covered in goo.

38875.name: Forlorn Stalker
38875.text: Battlecry: Give all Deathrattle minions in your hand +1/+1.
38875.flavorText: He's going to leave the dying up to you, if that's cool.

38909.name: Giant Sand Worm
38909.text: Whenever this attacks and kills a minion, it may attack again.
38909.flavorText: Banned from every all-you-can-eat buffet on Azeroth.

38533.name: Grotesque Dragonhawk
38533.flavorText: They say that "grotesque is in the eye of the beholder," but that's just because they've never seen a Grotesque Dragonhawk. Yikes!

38922.name: Herald Volazj
38922.text: Battlecry: Summon a 1/1 copy of each of your other minions.
38922.flavorText: His whole job is yelling "Yogg-Saron comin'!"

38944.name: Hogger, Doom of Elwynn
38944.text: Whenever this minion takes damage, summon a 2/2 Gnoll with Taunt.
38944.flavorText: When C'thun went to sleep, he checked under his bed for Hogger.

39033.name: Hooded Acolyte
39033.text: Taunt Whenever a character is healed, give your C'Thun +1/+1 (wherever it is).
39033.flavorText: Wait, what kind of acolyte doesn't wear a hood?

38329.name: Infest
38329.text: Give your minions "Deathrattle: Add a random Beast to your hand."
38329.flavorText: The best part is the look on their face when you jump out of the cake! Err… corpse.

38784.name: Infested Tauren
38784.flavorText: The Overmind and the Old Gods are surprisingly similar.

38734.name: Infested Wolf
38734.flavorText: A little flea powder will fix that right up.

38393.name: Journey Below
38393.flavorText: Don't stop believing there's something below.

38621.name: Klaxxi Amber-Weaver
38621.text: Taunt Battlecry: If your C'Thun has at least 10 Attack, gain +5 Health.
38621.flavorText: Amberweaving is a specialty course at the local trade school.

38739.name: Malkorok
38739.flavorText: Garrosh's best buddy. It's true. Look it up.

38337.name: Mark of Y'Shaarj
38337.text: Give a minion +2/+2. If it's a Beast, draw a card.
38337.flavorText: Y'Shaarj had three sons: Mark, Theodore, and Chris.

39008.name: Master of Evolution
39008.text: Battlecry: Transform a friendly minion into a random one that costs (1) more.
39008.flavorText: Will be really useful in the new "Hearthémon" game.

38957.name: Midnight Drake
38957.text: Battlecry: Gain +1 Attack for each other card in your hand.

38718.name: Mire Keeper
38718.text: Choose One - Summon a 2/2 Slime; or Gain an empty Mana Crystal.
38718.flavorText: "Hey.... Is that Mire for sale?" "No. I'm keeping it."

38468.name: Mukla, Tyrant of the Vale
38468.flavorText: Pro tip: DO NOT BOGART THE BANANAS.

38914.name: N'Zoth's First Mate
38914.flavorText: Hates when N'Zoth yells "Ahoy Matey!!", but there's not really much he can do about it.

38496.name: N'Zoth, the Corruptor
38496.text: Battlecry: Summon your Deathrattle minions that died this game.
38496.flavorText: Has not been able to get "Under the Sea" out of his head for like FIVE THOUSAND YEARS.

39046.name: Nat, the Darkfisher
39046.text: At the start of your opponent's turn, they have a 50% chance to draw an extra card.
39046.flavorText: You can take away his humanity, but you will never take away his fishing pole.

38517.name: Nerubian Prophet
38517.text: At the start of your turn, reduce this card's Cost by (1).

38377.name: On the Hunt
38377.flavorText: The mastiff giggles if you don't hit any ducks.

38961.name: Polluted Hoarder
38961.flavorText: Roll ‘greed’ OR THIS COULD HAPPEN TO YOU.

38774.name: Possessed Villager
38774.flavorText: It's like a pinata! A lame disgusting horrific pinata.

38426.name: Power Word: Tentacles
38426.flavorText: Because you're wrapped in a protective layer of… tentacles?

38262.name: Primal Fusion
38262.text: Give a minion +1/+1 for each of your Totems.
38262.flavorText: Golce and Dabbana have a new line of Earth Totems available at vendors everywhere this holiday season.

38910.name: Princess Huhuran
38910.flavorText: She flitters around Ahn'Qiraj dreaming of the day she will meet a sweet prince, whom she can lay thousands of eggs with.

38526.name: Psych-o-Tron
38526.flavorText: "Annoyinger-o-Tron" was just too unwieldy. And accurate.

38758.name: Ragnaros, Lightlord
38758.text: At the end of your turn, restore 8 Health to a damaged friendly character.
38758.flavorText: What happens when you try and corrupt a corrupted firelord? DOUBLE NEGATIVE, INSECT!

38745.name: Rallying Blade
38745.text: Battlecry: Give +1/+1 to your minions with Divine Shield.
38745.flavorText: As far as blades go, this one is pretty great in the motivation department.

38530.name: Ravaging Ghoul
38530.text: Battlecry: Deal 1 damage to all other minions.
38530.flavorText: But goes by "Ravishing Ghoul" when he hits the club.

38461.name: Renounce Darkness
38461.text: Replace your Hero Power and Warlock cards with another class's. The cards cost (1) less.

38832.name: Scaled Nightmare
38832.text: At the start of your turn, double this minion's Attack.
38832.flavorText: I like it because it scales.

38740.name: Selfless Hero
38740.text: Deathrattle: Give a random friendly minion Divine Shield.
38740.flavorText: "Don't worry about me… I'll just be here... under these tentacles."

38414.name: Servant of Yogg-Saron
38414.text: Battlecry: Cast a random spell that costs (5) or MORE (targets chosen randomly).
38414.flavorText: Yogg-Saron always likes to complain about how he has too many servants and there are too many mouths to feed.

38578.name: Shadow Strike
38578.text: Deal 5 damage to an undamaged character.
38578.flavorText: It's like a backstab, only from the front. And with two more stabs.

38433.name: Shadow Word: Horror
38433.text: Destroy all minions with 2 or less Attack.
38433.flavorText: It's more succinct than "Shadow Word: Suck Into Vortex."

38876.name: Shadowcaster
38876.text: Battlecry: Choose a friendly minion. Add a 1/1 copy to your hand that costs (1).
38876.flavorText: I mean, it's not creepy if you ASK before you steal their shadow to make a small replica of them to keep on your shelf.

38475.name: Shifter Zerus
38475.text: Each turn this is in your hand, transform it into a random minion.
38475.flavorText: It's like being able to play with THREE angry chickens!

39034.name: Shifting Shade
39034.text: Deathrattle: Copy a card from your opponent's deck and add it to your hand.
39034.flavorText: Yeah, it's cooler in the shade, but you're also more likely to get JACKED.

38304.name: Silithid Swarmer
38304.text: Can only attack if your hero attacked this turn.
38304.flavorText: If your hero doesn't attack, it's just "Silithid Loner".

39118.name: Skeram Cultist
39118.flavorText: Just before he comes into play, there is an AWESOME training montage with C'Thun.

39119.name: Soggoth the Slitherer
39119.flavorText: Don't tell Soggoth, but in the future he gets totally owned by the Master's Glaive and his skull becomes a tourist attraction.

38825.name: Southsea Squidface
38825.flavorText: Quick! Before I drown! Let me sharpen your sword for you.

38797.name: Spawn of N'Zoth
38797.flavorText: Who's a cute widdle N'Zoth? You are! Yes you are! Yes you're the cutest widdle N'Zoth in the whole world!!!

38456.name: Spreading Madness
38456.text: Deal 13 damage randomly split among ALL characters.
38456.flavorText: Most citizens of Darkshire wear those surgical masks to prevent spreading Madness to tourists.

39003.name: Squirming Tentacle
39003.flavorText: Yeah, I think we can agree that killing the squirming tentacle first is a good idea.

38843.name: Stand Against Darkness
38843.flavorText: Or if you're too tired, you can just kind of lean against the darkness.

38911.name: Steward of Darkshire
38911.text: Whenever you summon a 1-Health minion, give it Divine Shield.
38911.flavorText: Turns out divine shields are way cheaper if you buy in bulk.

38724.name: Stormcrack
38724.flavorText: WARNING: DO NOT TOUCH THE PURPLE BALL OF LIGHTNING

38532.name: Tentacle of N'Zoth
38532.flavorText: Because EVERYDAY is the Day of the Tentacle of N'zoth.

38279.name: Tentacles for Arms
38279.flavorText: That's right. Garrosh just slapped you to death with a tentacle.

38895.name: The Boogeymonster
38895.text: Whenever this attacks and kills a minion, gain +2/+2.
38895.flavorText: Has 20 years of training in classical ballet, but ALLLLLL he ever gets asked to do is boogie.

38267.name: Thing from Below
38267.text: Taunt Costs (1) less for each Totem you've summoned this game.
38267.flavorText: Just can't resist the opportunity to hang around with a bunch of totems.

38395.name: Thistle Tea
38395.text: Draw a card. Add 2 extra copies of it to your hand.
38395.flavorText: Aren't Thistles prickly? Why would you drink them? I don't get Rogues.

38429.name: Twilight Darkmender
38429.text: Battlecry: If your C'Thun has at least 10 Attack, restore 10 Health to your hero.
38429.flavorText: First she separates them from the lights, washes them in cold water, and hang-dries.

38868.name: Twilight Elder
38868.text: At the end of your turn, give your C'Thun +1/+1 (wherever it is).
38868.flavorText: Just doesn't understand those Twilight Youngsters any more - with their comic books and their rock music.

38409.name: Twilight Flamecaller
38409.text: Battlecry: Deal 1 damage to all enemy minions.
38409.flavorText: Make sure you summon a Twilight Marshmallowcaller too! Mmmm Mmm Mmm!!

38864.name: Twilight Geomancer
38864.text: Taunt Battlecry: Give your C'Thun +1/+1 and Taunt (wherever it is).
38864.flavorText: "Ok C'Thun, repeat after me: 'Your mother was a hamster.'"

38833.name: Twilight Summoner
38833.flavorText: If you strike him down, he shall become more powerful than you can possibly imagine.

38488.name: Twin Emperor Vek'lor
38488.text: Taunt Battlecry: If your C'Thun has at least 10 Attack, summon another Emperor.
38488.flavorText: Do they make decisions based on age? "I'm two minutes older therefore we burn this village."

38781.name: Twisted Worgen
38781.flavorText: Sometimes the Old Gods' corruptions gives you power untold, sometimes you get +1 Attack. We can’t all be winners in the Eldritch lottery.

39026.name: Undercity Huckster
39026.text: Deathrattle: Get a random card (from your opponent's class).
39026.flavorText: Psst! Wanna buy a random class card (from your opponent's class)?

38898.name: Usher of Souls
38898.text: Whenever a minion dies, give your C'Thun +1/+1 (wherever it is).
38898.flavorText: Nothing unburdens your soul like a good ushing!

38669.name: Validated Doomsayer
38669.text: At the start of your turn, set this minion's Attack to 7.
38669.flavorText: Really feels good about himself and is in a much better place now. But… he sure does miss piloting those shredders.

38227.name: Vilefin Inquisitor
38227.text: Battlecry: Your Hero Power becomes 'Summon a 1/1 Murloc.'

38655.name: Wisps of the Old Gods
38655.text: Choose One - Summon seven 1/1 Wisps; or Give your minions +2/+2.
38655.flavorText: They're just normal wisps, actually. The "Of the Old Gods" bit is just marketing.

38403.name: Xaril, Poisoned Mind
38403.text: Battlecry and Deathrattle: Add a random Toxin card to your hand.
38403.flavorText: It's basically your own fault if you go around drinking weird green potions handed out by creepy mantid dudes.

38312.name: Y'Shaarj, Rage Unbound
38312.text: At the end of your turn, put a minion from your deck into the battlefield.
38312.flavorText: When he's working out, he binds all that rage back into a ponytail.

38505.name: Yogg-Saron, Hope's End
38505.text: Battlecry: Cast a random spell for each spell you've cast this game (targets chosen randomly).
38505.flavorText: I spell your doom... Y-O-U-R D-O-O-M!

38541.name: Zealous Initiate
38541.flavorText: Ok, Initiate. You need to settle down and do your job. In this case, that means die so someone else can get a minor buff.
